author: Paul Gorst
title: Andy Carroll names former Liverpool duo Steven Gerrard and Luis Suarez in his ultimate five-a-side team
text:
Andy Carroll and Luis Suarez signed for Liverpool at the same time (Photo: Getty) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Andy Carroll may not be remembered fondly by Liverpool fans but the West Ham striker still showed a soft spot for some of his old team-mates when asked to name his dream five-a-side team. 
The West Ham striker was part of the Reds squad that won the 2012 League Cup alongside Gerrard and Suarez, and the ex-Reds stars left an impression on the Hammers forward, report the Liverpool Echo. 
Suarez and Gerrard are included alongside Kevin Nolan and Shay Given, and Carroll explained why he opted for the former Liverpool greats to the Premier League's official website. 
On iconic former Reds captain Gerrard, Carroll said: "His name just says it all! 
"He was a leader you know. He did it all his career at Liverpool, and he had another quality career and I think he's a great man. Steven Gerrard and Carroll head off to an England training session in 2012 (Photo: PA) 
"He was fantastic for England and Liverpool and just a great career." 
Carroll joined Liverpool for a club-record £35m from Newcastle in January 2011 - the same week Suarez signed from Ajax for around £23m, and the tall frontman talked up his former strike-partner's attributes. 
"His work-rate, his movement and his finishing was fantastic," said Carroll. 
"He was just a great player and obviously that's why he got his move to Barcelona [in 2014]." 
Carroll joined West Ham from the Reds on a permanent deal for around £15m in the summer of 2013 after a successful year on loan with the Londoners. Like us on Facebook
